column1: psychicpumpkinpi 161007810836 "2017-05-24 03:18:48 GMT" https://psychicpumpkinpi.tumblr.com/post/161007810836/wenamedthedogkylo-horticulturalcephalopod "wenamedthedogkylo:  horticulturalcephalopod:  owlbear-dont-care:  silverdrarry:  caseyanthonyofficial:  Why do people never want to tell you their middle name like who gives a shit its not a nuclear launch code its your damn name  reblog with your middle name in the tags  Actually
column2: the practice dates back to the reason we have middle names in the first place! Some time around the dark ages
column3: everyone believed in witchcraft and wizardry
column4: like ya do. A big principle of magic was the idea of “true names.” If a spellcaster knew your full name
column5: they could do whatever the hell they wanted to you. Of course
column7: but there were enough people with the same first names that you had to give people your surname as well
column8: to avoid confusion. The solution? A secret name in the middle that you don’t tell anyone (unless you believe that they’re not able to do magic and/or you trust them enough that if they DID do magic
column9: you’d be fine).  this is some death note shit  Is that why when a parent uses your full name (or even just first and middle name) when they’re angry with you
column10: it feels like they just cast some serious mojo on your soul and you know you are in deep shit? " False text

column1: psychicpumpkinpi 160988712781 "2017-05-23 16:33:58 GMT" https://psychicpumpkinpi.tumblr.com/post/160988712781/bigmouthlass-briwhosaysni-paralol "bigmouthlass: briwhosaysni:  paralol:  naked-yogi:  naked-yogi: As a society
column2: we need to stop assuming that everyone enjoys drinking alcohol. Lmao @ people who think I’m ridiculous for this post. I’m defensive because alcoholism is a huge issue. Everywhere in the world. Not to mention
column3: I know it’s hard for some of you fucks to believe because of how widely accepted alcohol is
column4: but there are a HUGE amount of people who have personal issues with alcohol. Either being recovering or previous alcoholics themselves
column5: having a close personal tie with someone who abused alcohol
column6: growing up in an unstable alcoholic household
column7: having DEEPLY EMBEDDED family or spouse issues ALL because of alcohol. FUCK OFF with your me being so offended bullshit. Just assume people are sober till you find out on **their** terms they aren’t. Don’t expect that everyone likes to drink. Just like you wouldn’t expect that everyone likes to smoke cannabis
column8: why would you do it with alcohol? (That’s rhetorical
column9: it’s obviously because basically everyone assumes the entire world enjoys drinking). It’s not hard. Don’t offer people drinks unless you know they drink. BYE.  My favorite response when I tell people im straight edge is “what? You’ll never drink ever? Not one drink? I don’t believe you.” And they’ll laugh And I’ll look them straight in their fucking eye and tell them both my parents
column10: and my aunt are recovering alcoholics. The rest of my family? Has never tried
column11: nor ever got the chance to recover from their addiction.  It’s by some miracle my mother is alive right now because she drank so much her liver stopped working. She was in a coma for two weeks. The doctors almost gave up on her. My dad was an abusive drunk and then turned to hard drugs and that certainly didn’t help anything. My 3 younger sisters and I were almost put into foster care because of the both of them. I was only about 14 at the time. Making my youngest sister
column12: 7. And because of all of this my family went bankrupt and we were almost homeless. All because of drinking :)  That usually shuts them up real fucking fast but
column13: I shouldn’t have to explain that to anyone. I shouldn’t have to defend my (perfectly healthy!) choices!  If someone tells you they don’t drink
column14: it’s for a fucking reason. Don’t be a dick. Casual alcoholism is a huge fucking problem in the world and its scary that most people can’t see it.  Also
column15: some people just… don’t like drinking. There are people out there who just genuinely do not enjoy drinking alcohol. They don’t like the taste
column17: and they have no desire to try to force themselves into enjoying it just because someone else thinks it’s “weird”. There are all kinds of reasons that someone might not choose to drink
column18: and all of those reasons are valid. There’s nothing wrong with it
column19: it doesn’t mean they “can’t have fun”
column20: and I guarantee you they’re not judging you for drinking. And if they are? It’s definitely not as much as they’re being judged for not drinking. Don’t try to force people to drink. Don’t assume everyone likes to drink. And if someone says they don’t drink? Don’t force them to explain why just to get you to stop hounding them.  There are plenty of reasons to avoid booze and the particulars of someone’s reasons are none of your business.  Nobody deserves to catch crap because they don’t imbibe. " False text

psychicpumpkinpi 160899058526 "2017-05-21 05:47:23 GMT" https://psychicpumpkinpi.tumblr.com/post/160899058526/tick-psa "biologyweeps: Alright you guys
column2: ‘tis the season again and I’ve already seen bullshit float about so here we go: what to do and what not to do when you happen to have a tick attached to yours truly. WHAT NOT TO DO: DON’T cover the tick in anything. Vaseline
column4: whatever. Doesn’t matter. It’ll all suffocate the tick
column5: making it panic vomit germs into your blood stream. That’s the opposite of what you want. DON’T burn the tick. Same problem
column6: plus the additional option of giving yourself a burn wound in the process.  DON’T squeeze the body of the tick when you try to remove it. Again this empties the tick’s digestive system into your body. Bad.  DON’T wait for the tick to detach itself. The longer it stays on you
column7: the higher the chances it’ll transmit anything to you. Plus when ti detaches it may again vomit germs into you.  WHAT TO ACTUALLY DO STAY CALM. A tick hanging on you is not a reason to panick. You’re not going to keel over just like that
column8: and if you’re unsure what to do
column9: there are many resources on the internet on how to safely remove a tick
column10: like this one from the CDC (aka the professionals) USE APPROPRIATE TOOLS. These can be suitable tweezers (the pointy kind
column12: tick removers (there are cheap ones out there
column13: those you can buy at the vets are totally fine for use on humans
column14: too!). Ideally you can remove the entire tick in one go
column15: however if that doesn’t work and the mouth part breaks off in your skin
column16: that’s not a terribly big deal and you can totally remove it separately after you got the body remove. Again
column17: don’t panic. KILL THE REMOVED TICK. But not by squeezing it. Flush it down the toilet
column18: submerse it in alcohol in a container etc. Ideally if the tick has bitten you and not your dog
column19: keep the tick around in a sealed container in case you start having symptoms and someone needs to identify the tick species. Also IF you start getting symptoms like the tell tale Lyme disease rash
column20: HIT A DOCTOR RIGHT AWAY AND TELL THEM ABOUT YOUR TICK BITE. Do not wait this out
column21: ticks can transmit a whole host of diseases beside Lyme
column23: too!  Some of those diseases you can actually get vaccinated again
column24: such as tick born encephalitis. Check with the local authorities if you live in a risk area
column26: get the shots to protect yourself.  " False text

This is real!!!   Free Video course by the creators from Pixar.    “Have you always wanted to be Pixar animator? Now that process is a tiny bit easier. The animation studio recently made a number of courses available on the Khan Academy website to help you start your journey - and they’re free.”   The group of courses are called “Pixar in a Box” and include short lessons on everything from character modeling and animation to using virtual cameras. Today
column2: it added a new course into the mix: The Art of Storytelling. The free course is an exploration into the storytelling process at Pixar. From the course description: “What makes someone a good storyteller? Storytelling is something we all do naturally
column4: but there’s a difference between good storytelling and great storytelling. In this lesson you’ll hear from Pixar directors and story artists about how they got their start
column6: and you’ll begin to think about what kinds of stories you might want to tell.” Read the full piece here CURRENT MOOD:   " False link
